Class LobbyScreenController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am16.client.view.gui.controllers.screens.LobbyScreenController
public class LobbyScreenController extends Object
Controller class for the lobby screen.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the lobby screen, registering events on the screen's buttons and to listen to incoming information from the server.

    • setGameId

      private void setGameId(String gameId)
      Sets the game ID to display on the screen.
      Parameters:
      gameId - The game ID.

    • setPlayers

      private void setPlayers(List<String> usernames)
      Sets the currently connected players so that their usernames can be shown to the player.
      Parameters:
      usernames - The list of currently connected players.

    • addPlayer

      private void addPlayer(String username)
      Adds a new player to the lobby and shows their username to the player.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the new player.

    • removePlayer

      private void removePlayer(String whoDisconnected)
      Removes the player with the given username and removes their name from the screen.
      Parameters:
      whoDisconnected - The username of the player who disconnected from the lobby.

    • updateMotd

      private void updateMotd()
      Updates the "Message Of The Day" in the lobby, showing the number of players missing for the game to start. If the number of expected players is reached, shows a message that tells the player that the game is starting shortly instead.

    • leave

      private void leave()
      Leaves the lobby, communicating this to the server. Switches back to the welcome screen.

    • receiveMessages

      private void receiveMessages(List<ChatMessage> messages)
      Adds the new messages to the chat.
      Parameters:
      messages - The received messages.

    • sendChatMessage

      private void sendChatMessage()
      Sends a new chat message to the server.

    • showChatFilter

      public void showChatFilter(javafx.event.ActionEvent ignored)
      Shows the chat filter box, with which users can decide whether to send public or private chat messages.

    • registerEvents

      private void registerEvents()
      Registers event handlers for this screen's buttons, or events fired by incoming information from the server.

    • inHierarchy

      private static boolean inHierarchy(javafx.scene.Node node, javafx.scene.Node potentialHierarchyElement)
      Checks whether the given node contains another node between its descendants.
      Parameters:
      node - The "father" node.
      potentialHierarchyElement - A potential descendant of the father node.
      Returns:
      Whether the given node is a descendant of the father node.
